history.content: Some students still fall under the requirement of needing to complete CS 61A, CS 61B, CS 61C, CS 70, Math 1A, Math 1B, Math 54 with a cumulative GPA of at least 3.00. If you entered UCB in Fall 2015 or later, you need to complete CS61AB and 70 with the 3.3. If you've taken the other classes then you can include those grades, but they are not factored into the GPA requirement starting Fall 2015.

children.subject:
You would need to take CS70, and then you can declare.

If your question was more about finishing the CS major in time, you're basically taking CS courses as if you're a transfer student (in that you have 2 years), which seems hard but empirically doable.
I guess my question is more about whether I could still declare a CS major after sophomore year because I heard people can only declare before junior.

You have to declare your first major before junior year. A second major is not subject to this requirement.

For example, I waited until my 8th semester before declaring my second/third majors.

Hey,

I entered in Fall 2015, but started taking CS classes a little bit too late. If I want to declare CS double major(my current major is Chemisty), but hasn't finished CS61C/70, would I still be able to declare before I graduate?

Thanks!

history.content:
I know that the prerequisites for declaring the CS major is just to get a 3.3 GPA across CS 61A, 61B, and 70. However,  On the major petition form: https://deptapps.coe.berkeley.edu/csapp/apply

It seems that I also need to finish CS 61C, and Math 1A/B and 54.

So can I declare if I've completed the 3 GPA requirement classes even though I haven't finished all of the other classes?
history.subject: Confusion about how to declare
